text: Albert Benjamin "Happy" Chandler Sr. (July 14, 1898 â€“ June 15, 1991) was an American politician. He represented Kentucky in the U.S. Senate and was its 44th and 49th Governor. Chandler was the second Commissioner of Baseball from 1945 to 1951 and was added into the Baseball Hall of Fame in 1982. His grandson, Ben Chandler, later was congressman for Kentucky's Sixth District. ==References== Category:1898 births Category:1991 deaths Category:United States senators from Kentucky Category:Governors of Kentucky Category:American military personnel of World War I Category:Sportspeople from Kentucky Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Military people from Kentucky Category:Major League Baseball commissioners
title: Happy Chandler
